greenmirror.commands

Class SetAnimationDurationCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenmirror.Command
      • greenmirror.commands.SetAnimationDurationCommand

  • public class SetAnimationDurationCommand
extends Command
    Sets the animation duration for following animations. This command is sent to the server.
    Values sent:
    variabletypedescription
    durationdoublethe animation duration

    The current version of GreenMirror uses the following order of priority on the animation duration:

    1. duration set during a state-transition;
    2. duration set with the state-transition (see ModelTransition.setDuration(double));
    3. duration set while initializing the visualizer (see (double, double, double)). This duration setting is stored by use of Visualizer.setDefaultAnimationDuration(double);
    4. 1000ms
    This means that if scenario 1 does not apply, the duration of 2 is chosen. If scenario 2 does not apply, the duration of 3 is chosen. If scenario 3 does not apply, duration 4 is chosen. Additionally, after each transition the duration gets reset, so scenario 1 is isolated to the state-transition it applies to. In both scenarios 1 and 2, the duration setting gets stored by use of Visualizer.setCurrentAnimationDuration(double).
    Author:
    Karim El Assal
    See Also:
    SetAnimationDurationCommandHandler
